content:
Forking from that topic @pnkfelix and @Esteban Küber (et al.)
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/131828-t-compiler/topic/reviewing.20P-high.20issues.202022.20.28Q1.29/near/270318969

One way could be to label some of these P-highs with E-mentor, if they're up for grab.

Then - but I'm not yet sure about this - there is a weekly newsletter with a "Call for Participation" section: This Week in Rust. For example, last week's issue:
https://this-week-in-rust.org/blog/2022/01/26/this-week-in-rust-427/

Usually it is used to find volunteers for rust projects, but perhaps also the team compiler (or any other subteam) could use it?

We can agree on a standard format to publish these issues. I can help by submitting PRs to that repository. Fictional example:

Hello! The compiler team is looking for volunteers to push these issues forward:
- "Associated const with supertrait associated type (named the same) causes ICE" [rust#93553](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93553), issue mentored by @_**Esteban Küber**
- "rustdoc ICE: 'no entry found for key''" [rust#93476](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/93476) issue mentored by @_**pnkfelix**
- ...

We offer onboarding and mentoring, get in touch on Zulip on #t-compiler

Oh interesting. At first I thought you were saying this machinery was already in place (which I was going to express surprise at), but you’re rather saying that we could implement a protocol so that issues (newly?) tagged with E-mentor get added to TWIR each week?
it certainly sounds like something to try. Can’t be bad to find new channels to broadcast this on, I think.

we could implement a protocol so that issues (newly?) tagged with E-mentor get added to TWIR each week?

well, that would be slightly beyond what I had in mind :sweat_smile: for now. I was thinking more something like: I could filter the list of P-high with E-mentor and - with or without a mentor available - I could post them in chunks on TwiR

I see. Before we jump into that, we should double check what the current set of those look like. (that is, I don’t want a firehose of issues being dumped on TWIR.) But I guess if you limit yourself to P-high, then it won’t be too overloaded, hopefully.
makes sense! or you can even simply point me to a subset of them, picked by hand
(yes, we want to avoid spamming on TwiR)
